io.github.reggert.reb4j.charclass

Class CharClass

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.reggert.reb4j.AbstractExpression
      • io.github.reggert.reb4j.AbstractAlternative
        • io.github.reggert.reb4j.AbstractSequenceableAlternative
          • io.github.reggert.reb4j.AbstractQuantifiableSequenceableAlternative
            • io.github.reggert.reb4j.charclass.CharClass
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Alternative, Expression, Quantifiable, Sequenceable, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CharRange, Intersection, MultiChar, Negated, PredefinedClass, SingleChar, Union

    public abstract class CharClass
extends AbstractQuantifiableSequenceableAlternative
implements Expression, Quantifiable, Sequenceable, Alternative
    Base class representing an expression that matches a single character within a class of characters.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CharClass.Java
      Module containing predefined character classes matching character traits defined by the Character class.
      static class  CharClass.Perl
      Module containing Perl-style predefined character classes.
      static class  CharClass.Posix
      Module containing POSIX-style predefined character classes.
      static class  CharClass.Unicode
      Module containing predefined character classes matching a single character that has certain traits defined by the Unicode specification.

      • boundedLength

        public Integer boundedLength()
        Description copied from interface: Expression
        Indicates the computed maximum length of the expression, if one can be determined.
        Specified by:
        boundedLength in interface Expression
        Returns:
        the computed maximum length, or null if it is unbounded.

      • repetitionInvalidatesBounds

        public boolean repetitionInvalidatesBounds()
        Description copied from interface: Expression
        Indicates whether applying repetition to the expression invalidates the boundedness computation. This generally indicates that the expression may match a zero-repetition ({0, n} or ?). This is used to determine boundedness of enclosing expressions.
        Specified by:
        repetitionInvalidatesBounds in interface Expression

      • possiblyZeroLength

        public boolean possiblyZeroLength()
        Description copied from interface: Expression
        Indicates whether the expression may possibly be zero length. Used in some cases for determining repetitionInvalidatesBounds.
        Specified by:
        possiblyZeroLength in interface Expression

      • range

        public static CharRange range(char first,
              char last)
        Constructs a character class consisting of all characters in a range.
        Parameters:
        first - the minimum bound for the range.
        last - the maximum bound for the range; must be greater than first.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if last <= first.
